Comment: There's not a rule against it, but it wouldn't work. It's not that simply being a certain party affiliation gives you special powers in Congress. It's that the House is governed by a majority rules system, and so as long as Kevin McCarthy can command 218 votes pretty much whenever he needs to, he can run the show. A Dem that's already outside that 218 switching to Rep wouldn't actually do anything further to take away that 218.  The reason the Rep defections at the start were such a big deal wasn't because they as Reps had a special ability to oppose McCarthy. It was because 20 defections meant that McCarthy didn't have 218 votes. Lacking a majority in the chamber basically means you can't govern, and that's what happened.
